bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Laura Armistead Carter, February 21, 1921

div1.p: Rose informs Laura Carter that they have heard from her father, who is still in Peru.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Laura Armistead Carter, February 21, 1921
div1.opener:
Copy.
International Health Board,
61 Broadway, New York.
February 21, 1921.
My Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
Saturday we received a cable from your Father sent from
Lima, which reads as follows:
JUST ARRIVED FROM INFECTED DISTRICT. WILL ADVISE.

We heard about a week ago that there was yellow fever in
Northern Peru and cabled your father about vaccine and serum. We
were not sure, however, but that he had left Peru before the out-
break and we had no definite word from him until we received the
cable quoted above.

It is a great comfort to me to know that he is on the ground to
look after the situation although I regret that anything has oc-
curred to keep him longer away from home.

I am sending the information on to you thinking it might
be later than any news you may have received.
